description: {displayName} is a cloud-based enterprise controller that makes it easy to build, manage and monitor your networks from anywhere.
title: {displayName} | A cloud-based network controller
retrievePassword1: Please follow the link for the account password you wish to reset. Links are valid for 24 hours.
retrievePassword4: If you don't want to reset your password, just ignore this email. Your password will not change.
createAccountEmail2: Someone (hopefully you) has requested that a master account {p0} be created on the CloudTrax.com dashboard.
createAccountEmail2a: If you made this request, please click the link below so we can finish creating your account. If you didn't make this request, you can simply ignore this email.
logoSuccess: Logo uploaded successfully! May take up to 10 minutes to update.
wishSuccess: Thank you for sending us your wish!
localizationSuccess: Thank you for sending us your feedback!
alertsType1Switch: {p0} switch(es) on this network need to be re-paired with {displayName}. Click to re-pair (so we know it’s you). {ts1}Learn more.{te2}
alertsType1SwitchShort: {p0} switch(es) on this network need to be re-paired with {displayName}.
alertsType1: {p0} access point(s) on this network need to be re-paired with {displayName}. Click to re-pair (so we know it’s you). {ts1}Learn more.{te2}
alertsType1Short: {p0} access point(s) on this network need to be re-paired with {displayName}.
alertsType1StatusComplete: Pairing complete. This error message should clear in less than five minutes.
alertsType2: Welcome to the all new CloudTrax! Check out the {ts0}quick tour{te1} to see what's new. Please {ts2}let us know{te3} if you encounter an issue or have feedback.
alertsType3: {p0} access point(s) on this network are down. {ts1}View{te2}{ts3}Learn more.{te4}
alertsType3Short: {p0} access point(s) on this network are down.
alertsType4: Scheduled maintenance: {displayName} will be down for maintenance from {p0} on {p1}. Networks will continue to function normally during this time.
alertsType5: One or more of your access points is upgrading to a newer firmware version. You may experience network interruptions, delayed reporting and delayed configuration changes during this time. Refresh this page for updates.
alert202: This network has a mix of 5xx and 6.x firmware devices. Some {displayName} features not supported by 5xx firmware will be visible, but will not be applied to the devices. To enable these features, upgrade all devices to 6.x firmware.
alert203: One or more of your offline nodes may be having trouble connecting to the internet because it is operating on a different country code from the ones that are online. If there are nodes that are plugged in, in repeater mode but not coming online, please plug them in over the wire at least once.
alert204: This network has a mix of 5xx and 6.x firmware devices. Some {displayName} features not supported by 5xx firmware will be visible, but will not be applied to the devices. To enable these features, upgrade all devices to 6.x firmware. Note: This network contains 32MB OM2P APs, which cannot run 6.x firmware.
alert205: Note: This network contains 32MB OM2P APs, which cannot run 6.x firmware. Some {displayName} features not supported by 5xx firmware will be visible, but will not be applied to the devices.
alert405: This network has switches running different firmware versions. Some of the configuration features below may not be applied on some switches of the network. Please consult the switch firmware release notes {ts0}here{te1} to determine what these features are and if you should consider upgrading all of your switches to the latest FW version.
alert302: Your custom.sh script was not applied to all access points. {ts0}Learn more{te1}.
loginGreeting: Use your CloudTrax 3, CloudTrax 4, Lobby Assistant or read-only credentials below.
loginPasswordRecoverInstructions: To reset your password or verify your account, enter the account name or email address you use to sign in to {displayName}.
loginPasswordRecoverComplete: We've received your password reset request. Please check your inbox.
loginPasswordResetComplete: Password updated successfully. {ts0}Click here to login.{te1}
loginPasswordResetInstructions: Enter your new password for your {p0} {displayName} account.
loginRecoverError1: Unable to reset your password based on the provided information.
loginRecoverError2: Unable to reset your password based on the provided information. (2)
loginRecoverError3: Unable to reset your password based on the provided information. (3)
loginRecoverError4: You've had too many password reset attempts on this account. Please check your inbox and spam folder for an email from no-reply@cloudtrax.com. Still no email? {ts0}Contact support{te1}.
loginPasswordResetError1: Unable to reset your password based on the provided information.
loginError1: Please enter a valid Account or Network name
loginError5: Your username and/or password is incorrect.
loginError6: You have too many failed login attempts. Please reset your password to re-gain access.
header2: The easy way to build, manage and monitor your network from anywhere.
mobileText: Build, manage and monitor networks on your mobile device.
supportText: Get documentation, ask questions and more in the new {ts0}Help Center{te1}
nodeUpdateFailure: Access point could not be updated
nodeStatus1: Cannot resolve default dashboard host name via DNS: firmware-ng will use the fallback IP instead.
nodeStatus2: Cannot resolve alternate dashboard host name via DNS: firmware-ng will try to use the fallback IP instead or the default dashboard if that fails.
nodeStatus14: alternate checkin path broken that should never come up
nodeAddSuccess: Success! Your access point has been added. It should start reporting here 5 minutes after plugging it in.
nodeTransferSuccess: Success! Your access point has been transferred.
settingsSubmitSuccess: Success! Network settings saved. Allow 1-2 minutes for changes to take effect.
settingsRadioSubmitSuccess: Success! Network settings saved. Changes could take several minutes to reflect on the Access Points.
settingsSubmitFailure: Oops... Something’s not quite right. Please correct the fields marked below.
deleteNetworkVerificationError: To delete this network, type "{p0}" exactly in the field below.
settingsDisplayCloudtraxTip: Update the look and feel of your {displayName} dashboard.
settingsDisplayEmbedsTip: Use the HTML snippet to embed {displayName} features on an external site like a client portal. {ts0}Learn more{te1}.
alphanumeric: Can only contain letters and numbers
alphanumericDashUnderscoreSpace: Can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, dashes and spaces
alphanumericDashUnderscoreSpacePeriodCom: Can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, dashes, spaces, periods and commas
eightCharacterMinimum: Must be 8 or more characters long
validOuiNoMulticastOnly: Valid OUIs only. MAC address cannot be a multicast address (starting with 01).
nodeMapAddNodeError1: Error adding Access Point.{lb}{lb}Click here to continue.
nodeMapUpdateNodeError1: Error updating Access Point.{lb}{lb}Click here to continue.
nodeMapOverlayCreateError: Error creating overlay.{lb}{lb}Click here to continue.
nodeMapOverlayDeleteError: Error deleting overlay.{lb}{lb}Click here to continue.
nodeMapOverlayUpdateError: Error updating overlay.{lb}{lb}Click here to continue.
voucherTableStatusUntrackedTip: This voucher is set to allow unlimited devices. {displayName} does not track individual users when this setting is applied.
voucherOverMax: Too many vouchers for this network
customVoucherNameError: Only single vouchers can be given custom names
voucherNameUnavailable: Voucher code already exists. Voucher codes are case insensitive.
voucherRequireAlert: You appear to be using vouchers. You must enable Bandwidth Throttling to enforce voucher bandwidth limits.
voucherUpdateInstructions: Edit and renew this voucher below.
voucherCreateInstructions1: Note: Bandwidth Throttling (under SSID configuration) must be enabled, for the below bandwidth limits to be enforced.
voucherPurgeText: Deleted and expired vouchers will be auto-purged daily. Unused vouchers will be auto-purged after the specified number of days.
voucherMaxText: Maximum number of vouchers is 2,000 per network or 100 per access point, whichever is greater.
ssidGeneralNameValidation: Must be unique within the network and must be between one and 32 characters (maximum of 32 bytes).
settingsSsidCaptivePortalTip: Learn more about the captive portal and splash pages in the {ts0}{displayName} Help Center{te1}. For Facebook WiFi, visit the {ts2}Facebook Help Center{te3}.
settingsSsidCaptivePortalLegacyTip: Learn more about the captive portal and splash pages in the {ts0}{displayName} Help Center{te1}.
ssidAdvancedDnsServerAddressesTip: Enter Alternate DNS server IP addresses, one per line, for this SSID. This setting will override your network-wide Alternate DNS settings on this SSID. This allows you to use services such as OpenDNS for content filtering, client tracking and more.
cpFacebookPairingFailure: Unable to retrieve information from Facebook.
cpFacebookPairingPrompt: Once you've configured Facebook WiFi by clicking the button above, return to this page to save changes.
ssidCpEnableIncludeUserdataOnRedirect: Include user data in redirect URL
nodeTableTip1: Select {ts0}map view{te1} to add or edit access points.
nodeMapTip1: Click a location on the map to add a new access point.
nodeMapTip2: Click the map to add a new access point. Click existing access points to edit them, or click and drag to move them.
manageNetworkCreateSuccess: Success! Your network has been created. Add your first access point below. Click the map to add additional access points.
manageNetworkCloneSuccess1: Success! Your network has been cloned.
manageNetworkCloneSuccess3: If using Paypal, create a new button for your splash page.
manageNetworkCloneSuccess4: If using Facebook WiFi, re-pair your SSID.
manageNetworkDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this network ({p0})?{lb}{lb}All access points will be removed from the network and all records of this network will be lost. This action cannot be undone.
signupInvalidEmail: A valid email address is required
signupError1: Please verify the fields marked in red below
signupError2: Please select the type of user you are
signupCompleteMessage1: Check your email. We’ve sent a link to {p0} to verify your email and complete the signup process.
signupCompleteMessage2: No email? Check your spam folder.
signupCompleteMessage3: Still no? {ts0}Click here{te1} to send it again.
signupVerifyMessage1: You're signed up for {displayName}. Now it's time to build your first network.
signupVerifyMessage2: Head over to the {ts0}Sign in{te1} page to get started. If you need a hand, check out the {ts2}Getting Started Guides{te3} in the {displayName} Help Center.
advancedCustomScriptUrlPlaceholderError: Must be a URL to a directory and end with a forward slash
detectTimezone: Find time zone based on Location
signupEmailTip: A valid email address is required. We’ll use this to contact you for {displayName}-related issues. No spam - we promise.
networksCreateNameTip: The name for this network. Networks are simply a logical grouping of access points that share the same settings and reporting.
networksCreatePasswordTip: Enter a password that is unique from your master username and password. This will allow you to provide access to this individual network without providing access to all networks.
networksCreateEmailTip: We've copied the email address from your master username. You can change this if you'd like to use the email address of a site manager or client.
networksCreateLocationTip: Physical location of the network. If you don't have the full address, enter the zip code (US) or city and country. This makes adding your access points easier via a Google Map.
settingsGeneralNetworkNameTip: The name of this network, and also the login ID to access this network individually.
settingsGeneralLocationTip: Physical location of the network. Once your access points are added, move them with the map tool on the Access Points page.
settingsGeneralTimezoneTip: The timezone of the network. All reports will use this to show time.
settingsGeneralDisableInternetCheckTip: When selected, the wireless network will only be available when there is an active Internet connection. This allows access points to recover quickly when they lose a connection and is the recommended setting. When deselected, the wireless network will stay up even when there is no Internet connection. This allows local resources such as printers and shared drives to continue to function, but access points may take longer to recover when they lose a connection.
settingsGeneralNotificationEmailAddressT: Add email addresses you'd like to send alerts to when an access point goes offline. Separate multiple email addresses with spaces.
settingsGeneralNotesTip: Enter any unique notes for this installation you'd like to be able to refer to later.
ssidGeneralNameTip: Enter the name you'd like users to see broadcast on all access points. Check the box below to use each access point's name for its SSID instead.
ssidGeneralEnableUseNodeNameTip: When selected, each Access Point will broadcast as its SSID a concatenation of its own name and the contents of the SSID field displayed above.
ssidGeneralEnableTip: When enabled, this SSID will broadcast on all access points in this network. When disabled, the SSID won't be broadcast. If a WiFi schedule is also active, it will control the SSID only if this master switch is enabled.
ssidGeneralEnableHiddenNetworkTip: When enabled, this SSID will advertise itself in a user's list of networks to connect to. When disabled, users must manually enter the SSID name.
ssidGeneralWifiAuthTypeTip: Determines initial authentication for this network. Open: users can connect without first entering a password and can be directed to a splash page. Pre-Shared Key: a single password, 8 characters or longer, that must be shared to all users. Enterprise: Uses 802.1x authentication that requires a unique username and password for each user.
ssidGeneralWpa2OnlyTip: Enable for better security. Disable to support some legacy devices that can't connect with WPA2.
ssidGeneralWpaPasswordTip: Password (also called a key or PSK) for users to connect to this network. Must be eight characters or longer with no spaces.
ssidCpSplashPageTip: When enabled, users must click to enter, enter a voucher, or purchase time via PayPal for access to your network. Learn more about splash pages in the {ts0}{displayName} Help Center{te1}. For Facebook WiFi, visit the {ts2}Facebook Help Center{te3}.
ssidCpSplashPageLegacyTip: When enabled, users must click to enter, enter a voucher, or purchase time via PayPal for access to your network. Learn more about splash pages in the {ts0}{displayName} Help Center{te1}.
ssidCpClientForceTimeoutTip: Minutes between showing splash page regardless of activity for non-voucher access. 1 day=1440.
ssidCpLoginMethodTip: Learn about splash page authentication types in the {ts0}{displayName} Help Center{te1}.
ssidCpAfterSplashPageRedirectUrlTip: The page to display after the splash page. Leave blank to display the user's requested page. This option requires a splash page to display first.
ssidCpEnableTrafficShapingTip: When enabled, each client device on this SSID will have upload and download speeds limited to the values set below. Required if you are using throttling on vouchers, PayPal, RADIUS and HTTP Auth; this value will be overridden by the voucher, PayPal, RADIUS, or HTTP Auth setting.
ssidCpEnableBlockPreauthClientsTip: Block all ports until a client device has been authenticated. If unchecked, only browsing (HTTP/ Port 80 traffic) is blocked. Captive portal is only displayed in case of HTTP traffic, other traffic is blocked without a captive portal.
ssidCpEnableRequireValidLoginTip: Require a valid voucher on splash pages. If unchecked, allows you to provide a basic tier of service at the rates and durations above and (optionally) faster service using vouchers or PayPal.
ssidCpEnableFailsafeTip: Enable this to allow clients to connect to the internet, when the authentication server is unreachable.
ssidCpWhitelistTip: MAC addresses, one per line that will not see the splash page. Useful for game consoles and other devices that do not have a browser. Bandwidth throttling still applies to whitelisted devices.
ssidCpBlocklistTip: MAC addresses, one per line, that are blocked from this network.
ssidCpBlockMessageTip: Message to display on the splash page to users who are blocked. Requires firmware NG r347 or later, 128 characters max.
ssidAdvancedWifiWhitelistTip: MAC addresses, one per line, that are allowed to use this SSID. All other users will not be able to connect to this SSID. Leave blank to allow all MAC addresses.
ssidCpWalledGardenTip: Sites users can visit prior to authentication. Valid host names or IP addresses should be provided, each on a separate line.
ssidAdvancedEnableLanBlockTip: Prevents users on the wireless networks from accessing your wired LAN
ssidAdvancedEnableApIsolationTip: Prevents wireless clients from connecting to other wireless clients on the network. Disabling this will allow you to do things like share a printer, speaker or media hub attached to the network, but will also allow malicious users access to other clients. Disable only in private networks or if you know all users have a firewall enabled on their computers.
ssidAdvancedSmtpRedirectServerAddressTip: Alternate SMTP server IP address for your network. This allows users to send SMTP email by using your ISP's SMTP server.
ssidAdvancedVlanTagTip: Traffic on this SSID will be bridged and tagged with the specified VLAN (allowed range is 2-4094). Must be used only with 802.1Q compatible switches and routers. Don't enable this feature if you have non-VLAN capable switches or routers.
radioCountryCodeTip: The regulatory domain which sets available channels and maximum power. This is set automatically based on the geo-location reported by the nodes in the network.
radioTxPowerTip: Manually set the maximum transmit power for access points on this network. Maximum power is also limited by country regulations and hardware. This can be used to reduce power on dense indoor networks with higher power devices.
radioEnableAutorfTip: Auto will let {displayName} optimize channel settings nightly for your network. Manual lets you specify a single channel per band to use for all access points (you can override individual access points in Manage > Access Points). If Auto is selected then the ability to specify channels, on either a per-network or per-access point basis, is disabled.
radioChannel24Tip: Set the default 2.4 GHz channel for all access points. Wide channels are not recommended for environments with a lot of interference. You can override this setting by editing individual access points.
radioChannel5Tip: Set the default 5 GHz channel for all access points. Wide channels are not recommended for environments with a lot of interference. You can override this setting by editing individual access points.
upgradeDisableTip: When enabled, your network will automatically upgrade to the latest version as new upgrades become available.
upgradeFirmwareReleaseTip: Select a firmware release for access points on the network. Firmware upgrades take place during the Maintenance Window.
upgradeSwitchFirmwareReleaseTip: Select a firmware release for switches on the network. Firmware upgrades take place during the Maintenance Window.
radioAutorfHourTip: Select a time period for upgrades and Auto RF changes to take place that minimizes disruption.
settingsGeneralDisplayNameTip: This text can be accessed using the display name variable and used for a custom title for the report you create, using custom code snippets.
settingsSsidGatewayNameTip: This will be displayed in place of $gatewayname in the splash page. Leave this empty to use the SSID name.
settingsGeneralLogoTip: Load your own logo to replace the {displayName} logo in the top left corner of the application.
settingsGeneralDisablePublicAccessTip: Click to enable the password-free read-only view of the network status. When enabled, read-only view can be accessed by entering just the network name in {displayName} without a password. The password will still be required to change any network settings.
settingsGeneralEnable12hDisplayTip: Check to display time in 12 hour (am/pm) format.
embedSnippetTip: Only one SCRIPT tag is required per HTML page in order to use any amount of {displayName} embeds.
settingsDisplayEmbedDisableTip: Permanently deactivate the current embed. Please note that this action cannot be reversed. Deactivating the embed will permanently disable the current key and token and reactivation will create new ones.
advancedNodeRootPasswordTip: Root password for all access points on your network used for ssh. This was randomly generated when you created this network.
advancedEnableMeshEncryptionTip: Encrypts all mesh traffic with WPA2 protection. Access points not belonging to this network won't be able to join the mesh due to the encryption. Requires firmware-ng r466 or later.
advancedSmtpRedirectServerAddressTip: Enter the IP address of your Internet Service Provier's SMTP server to allow users to send SMTP email by using your ISP's SMTP server.
advancedDnsDomainNameTip: Local domain to use for resources without fully qualified domain names on the LAN. Requires that an Alternate DNS server be defined.
advancedDnsServerIpAddressTip: Alternate DNS server IP address for your network, such as OpenDNS. OpenDNS provides several additional features such as content filtering that you may find helpful.
advancedCustomScriptUrlTip: Enter the URL for the custom.sh script you want to install on all access points in this network. This is a developer option used to install additional features and is not used in normal operation.
advancedEnableShareVoucherTip: When enabled, vouchers created on this network will be usable on all other networks under this account.
advancedWiredBridgeSsidTip: When a wired client is connected to an access point, it will use settings from this SSID.
advancedWirelessBridgeSsidTip: Select an SSID to bridge to the LAN. This gives clients access to LAN resources such as file servers and printers, disables NAT and lets your LAN assign all client DHCP addresses. You can bridge additional SSIDs by using a VLAN tag on each SSID settings page.
advancedWirelessBridgeSsid2Tip: This gives clients access to LAN resources such as file servers and printers, disables NAT and lets your LAN assign all client DHCP addresses. You can bridge additional SSIDs by using a VLAN tag on each SSID settings page.
advancedPaypalTip: Allows using PayPal Buy Now buttons on your splash pages to sell internet access. See {ts0}Using PayPal with {displayName}{te1} for more information. These settings are applied to all SSIDs but, Bandwidth Throttling (under the specific SSID's captive portal configuration settings) must also be enabled, for the below bandwidth limits to be enforced.
paypalMaxUserCountTip: Number of client devices per PayPal purchase. Typically 1-5 (up to 10).
paypalDownloadLimitTip: Download bandwidth throttle per client device (in kbps) for PayPal.
paypalUploadLimitTip: Upload bandwidth throttle per client device (in kbps) for PayPal.
paypalPdtKeyTip: The token created by PayPal for this account.
usernameTip: This username allows you to manage all of your networks in one place. If you want to create a new network, do so within CloudTrax - don’t create a new username.
termsConfirm: I agree to the {ts0}terms of use{te1}
signupInfoP1: CloudTrax is the easy way to manage and monitor your networks.
signupInfoP2: It's free to use for as long as you want, with an unlimited number of networks and access points.
termsError: You must accept the terms of use.
passwordFailure0: Passwords must be between 8 and 50 characters long, limited to upper and lower-case letters (A through Z), the digits 0 through 9, and punctuation.
rootPasswordFailure0: Root passwords must be between 6 and 50 characters long, limited to upper and lower-case letters (A through Z), the digits 0 through 9, and punctuation.
wpaPasswordFailure0: WPA passwords must be between 8 and 63 characters long, limited to upper and lower-case letters (A through Z), the digits 0 through 9, and punctuation.
nodeMapDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this access point?{lb}{lb}This action cannot be undone and all records of this access point will be lost.
nodeMapTransferConfirm: Are you sure you want to transfer this access point?
nodeTablePlurateDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete these access points?{lb}{lb}This action cannot be undone and all records of these access points will be lost.
beforeUnloadMessage: You have unsaved changes that will be lost.
beforeUnloadMessage2: You have switched networks in a different tab or window. You also have unsaved changes that will be lost.
invalidNetworkName: Must be between 3 and 30 characters (alphanumeric, dash, space, underscore)
invalidPurgeDays: Must be a whole number between 1 and 999
invalidMaxUsers: Must be a whole number between 0 and 9
invalidDuration: Must be a whole number between 1 and 8760
invalidVoucherQuantity: Must be a whole number between 1 and 999
invalidRemoteServerUrl: Must be a valid URL containing the protocol, domain, and path. Query strings are not allowed.
invalidVoucherCode: Voucher codes are limited to upper and lower-case letters (A through Z), the digits 0 through 9, and punctuation.
firmwareRequired: This feature requires firmware version 578 or later.
voucherDurationTextTip: This text will precede the voucher duration on the printed voucher
voucherSettingsAccessTextTip: This text will precede the voucher code on the printed voucher
voucherSettingsBorderTip: Controls whether a border is drawn around the printed voucher
voucherSettingsLogoTip: Controls whether the company logo is drawn on the printed voucher
voucherSettingsLobbyAssistantPasswordTip: Logging in with this password will limit control of {displayName} to features required for creating and printing vouchers
ssidCpEnableIncludeUserdataOnRedirectTip: If set, additional information specific to the request is added as URL parameters when the final redirect occurs. The parameters node_mac, client_mac, and client_url will be set to the MAC addresses of the Access Point and Client, and the original request URL, respectively.
ssidCpLoginMethodRadiusServerAddress1Tip: Hostname of the primary RADIUS server
ssidCpLoginMethodRadiusServerAddress2Tip: Hostname of the secondary RADIUS server
ssidCpLoginMethodRadiusServerSecretTip: A supplied server secret will be presented to the RADIUS server and remote UAM server, if configured, and can used to verify the identity of the caller
ssidCpLoginMethodRadiusEnablePreauthMacp: Check this if you would like the Access Point to pass the client MAC address for both username and password. Leaving this unchecked will send MAC address as username and a blank string as password.
ssidCpLoginMethodRadiusNasIdTip: The NAS can be supplied in order to provide context information for the RADIUS server and remote UAM server, if configured
ssidCpLoginMethodHttpUrlTip: The full URL of the primary HTTP authentication server
ssidCpLoginMethodHttpSecretTip: A supplied server secret will be presented to the HTTP authentication server, and can used to verify the identity of the caller
privacyParagraph1: This Privacy Policy explains how information about you is collected, used and disclosed by {legalDisplayName} ("{ts0}{legalDisplayName}{te1}").  This Privacy Policy applies to information we collect when you use our websites, mobile applications and other online products and services that link to this Privacy Policy (collectively, the "{ts2}Services{te3}") or when you otherwise interact with us.
privacyParagraph2: We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time.  If we make changes, we will notify you by revising the date at the top of the policy and, in some cases, we may provide you with additional notice (such as adding a statement to our homepage or sending you a notification).  We encourage you to review the Privacy Policy whenever you access the Services or otherwise interact with us to stay informed about our information practices and the ways you can help protect your privacy.
privacyParagraph3: We collect information you provide directly to us.  For example, we collect information when you create an account, participate in any interactive features of the Services, fill out a form, make a purchase, request customer support or otherwise communicate with us.  The types of information we may collect include your name, email address, postal address, phone number, fax number, credit or debit card information, PayPal account information and any other information you choose to provide.
privacyHeader5: Information We Collect Automatically When You Use the Services
privacyParagraph4: When you access or use our Services, we automatically collect information about you, including:
privacyList1: {ts0}Log Information:{te1}  We collect log information about your use of the Services, including the type of browser you use, access times, pages viewed on our site, and your IP address.
privacyList2: {ts0}Device Information:{te1}  We collect information about the computer or mobile device you use to access our Services, including the hardware model, operating system and version, unique device identifiers and in some cases, mobile network information.  We also collect this for customers who use networks managed by our services.
privacyList3: {ts0}Location Information:{te1}  We collect information about the location of your devices each time you or users of {legalDisplayName} networks access the network or use one of our mobile applications or otherwise consent to the collection of this information.  For more details, please see "Your Choices" below.
privacyList4: {ts0}Information Collected by Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies:{te1}  We and our service providers use various technologies to collect information, including cookies and beacons.
privacyList5: {ts0}Information Collected by Packet Inspection (DPI) and Other Technologies:{te1}  We inspect traffic flowing through your network in an attempt to identify the sites visited and applications (eg Netflix, Skype, etc) used on the network.  This information is presented to you by the {legalDisplayName} network controller to help you understand how your network(s) are being used.  This is done at the access point level and aggregate data about the traffic, not the traffic itself, flows to our servers.
privacyList6: {ts0}Information We Collect From Other Sources:{te1}  We may also obtain information from other sources and combine that with information we collect through our Services.  For example, we may collect information about you from third parties, including but not limited to identity verification services and publicly available sources. If you log into your account through a social media site, we will have access to certain information from that site, which may include your name and account information, in accordance with the authorization procedures determined by such social media site.
privacyParagraph5: We may use information about you for various purposes, including to:
privacyList7: Provide, maintain and improve our Services;
privacyList8: Provide and deliver the products and services you request, process transactions and send you related information, including confirmations and invoices,
privacyList9: Send you technical notices, updates, security alerts and support and administrative messages;
privacyList10: Respond to your comments, questions and requests and provide customer service;
privacyList11: Communicate with you about products, services, offers, and promotions offered by {legalDisplayName} and others, and provide news and information we think will be of interest to you;
privacyList12: Monitor and analyze trends, usage and activities in connection with our Services;
privacyList13: Personalize and improve the Services and provide content or features that match user profiles or interests;
privacyList14: Carry out any other purpose for which the information was collected.
privacyParagraph6: {legalDisplayName} is based in the United States and the information we collect is governed by U.S. law.  By accessing or using the Services or otherwise providing information to us, you consent to the processing and transfer of information in and to the U.S. and other countries.
privacyParagraph7: We may share information about you as follows or as otherwise described in this Privacy Policy:
privacyList15: With vendors, consultants and other service providers who need access to such information to carry out work on our behalf;
privacyList16: In response to a request for information if we believe disclosure is in accordance with, or required by, any applicable law, regulation or legal process;
privacyList17: If we believe your actions are inconsistent with our user agreements or policies, or to protect the rights, property and safety of {legalDisplayName} or others;
privacyList18: In connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of {legalDisplayName} assets, financing or acquisition of all or a portion of our business by another entity; and
privacyList19: With your consent or at your direction.
privacyParagraph8: We may also share aggregated or de-identified information, which cannot reasonably be used to identify you.
privacyParagraph9: We may allow others to provide analytics services.  These entities may use cookies, beacons and other technologies to collect information about your use of the Services and other websites, including your IP address, location, device and OS type and version, web browser, pages viewed, time spent on pages, links clicked and conversion information.  This information may be used by {legalDisplayName} and others to, among other things, analyze and track data, determine the popularity of certain content, and better understand your online activity.
privacyParagraph10: {legalDisplayName} takes reasonable measures to help protect information about you from loss, theft, misuse and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration and destruction.
privacyParagraph11: You may update, correct or delete information about you at any time by logging into your online account.  If you wish to delete or deactivate your account, you may do so on {thisHostname} but note that we may retain certain information as required by law or for legitimate business purposes.  We may also retain cached or archived copies of information about you for a certain period of time.
privacyParagraph12: When you first launch any of our mobile applications that collect location information, you will be asked to consent to the application's collection of this information. We currently require this location information in order to use our Services, so if you do not consent to this collection, you cannot use our Services. If you initially consent to our collection of location information, you can subsequently stop the collection of this information at any time by changing the preferences on your mobile device. If you do so, our mobile applications, or certain features thereof, will no longer function. You may also stop our collection of location information by following the standard uninstall process to remove all of our mobile applications from your device.
privacyParagraph13: You may opt out of receiving promotional emails from {legalDisplayName} by following the instructions in those emails or by logging in to your account and changing your communications preferences.  If you opt out, we may still send you non-promotional communications, such as those about your account or our ongoing business relations.
privacyParagraph14: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:
privacyAddress: 5 Centerpointe Drive Suite 400{lb}Lake Oswego, OR 97035{lb}United States{lb}Email: {ts0}support@open-mesh.com{te1}{lb}Phone: 503-616-2764
maintenanceWindowDaysError: At least one day must be selected
termsParagraph1: This {legalDisplayName} Services Agreement (this “Agreement”), by and between {legalDisplayName} and you (“you” or “Customer”), governs your access to, and use of, the {legalDisplayName} cloud-based network controller platform.  Please read this Agreement carefully.  If you do not agree to all the terms and conditions of this Agreement, you may not access or use the Services.
termsParagraph2: {ts0}BY CLICKING THE “I AGREE” BUTTON, CREATING A {legalDisplayName} ACCOUNT OR ACCESSING OR USING ANY PART OF THE SERVICES, YOU AGREE TO COMPLY WITH AND BE BOUND BY THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THIS AGREEMENT.{te1}
termsParagraph3: If you are entering into this Agreement on behalf of a company or other entity, you represent that you have the authority to bind such entity to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.  In such event, “you” and “your” as used in this Agreement refer to such entity.
termsParagraph4: 1. {ts0}Privacy Policy{te1}.  Please read the {legalDisplayName} Privacy Policy at {p2} for information about how {legalDisplayName} collects, uses and discloses information about you.  The {legalDisplayName} Privacy Policy is incorporated into this Agreement by this reference.
termsParagraph5: 2. {ts0}Services{te1}.  As used in this Agreement, “Services” means the cloud‑based network controller platform made available by {legalDisplayName} through the {legalDisplayName} website located at *.{thisHostname} or through a {legalDisplayName} mobile app.  On the condition that you continue to comply with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, {legalDisplayName} hereby grants to you the nonexclusive, limited right to access and use the Services to set up and manage one or more wireless networks consisting of Designated Devices.  A list of “Designated Devices” is located at {ts2}[link]{te3}.  {legalDisplayName} may revise the list of Designated Devices from time to time.
termsParagraph6: 3. {ts0}Account{te1}.  To access the Services, you need to set up an account on the {legalDisplayName} website.  You are responsible for all acts and omissions of the users of your account and all activities taken through the use of your account.
termsParagraph7: 4. {ts0}Authorized Use{te1}.  You may use the Services only within the scope of the rights granted in Section 2 of this Agreement.  You have no right to (a) use any part of the Services to set up or manage any wireless networks that include routers, access points, gateways, repeaters or devices other than Designated Devices, (b) allow any unauthorized person to access or use the Services through your account, (c)  reverse engineer or attempt to discover any code or trade secrets related to any part of the Services, (d) modify or create derivative works based on any aspect of the Services, except by your use of the built-in splash page editor or other built-in tools that {legalDisplayName} may offer to you to customize the user interface components of the networks you create by your use of the {legalDisplayName} Services, (e) use the Services in any way that interferes with, disrupts, damages, or accesses in any unauthorized manner the servers, networks, data or other properties or services of {legalDisplayName} or any other person or entity, (f) access or use any part of the Services to develop a competitive service or product, or (g) use the Services outside the scope of the rights granted in Section 2 of this Agreement (collectively “Unauthorized Activities”).  {legalDisplayName} grants to you the rights set forth in Section 2 of this Agreement for no fee on the condition that you do not engage in any Unauthorized Activity, and you agree that you will not engage in any Unauthorized Activity.
termsParagraph8: 5. {ts0}Compliance with Law{te1}.  You agree to comply with all laws applicable to your access to or use of the Services.
termsParagraph9: 6. {ts0}Suspension{te1}.  {legalDisplayName} reserves the right to suspend or disable Customer’s access to and/or use of the Services without notice or liability if {legalDisplayName} believes such suspension is necessary to comply with {legalDisplayName}’s legal obligations.
termsParagraph10: 7. {ts0}Modification of the Services{te1}.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement or in any {legalDisplayName} website, {legalDisplayName} reserves the right to change, add or remove any functionality, features and/or other aspects of the Services, from time to time.
termsParagraph11: 8. {ts0}Maintenance and Upgrades{te1}.  The Services may be unavailable to you from time to time for maintenance and/or upgrades.  {legalDisplayName} will use commercially reasonable efforts to minimize any such disruptions.
termsParagraph12: 9. {ts0}Third Party Services{te1}.  As a convenience to its customers, {legalDisplayName} may provide links to services or products offered by third parties.  You may wish to use such services or products in connection with your use of the {legalDisplayName} Services.  Each of such third-party services or products is provided to you by the provider of such services pursuant to separate agreements between you and the provider of such services or products.  {legalDisplayName} does not endorse any third-party service or product.  {legalDisplayName} makes no representation or warranty with respect to any third-party service or product, and {legalDisplayName} assumes no liability with respect to your use of any third‑party service or product.
termsParagraph13: 10. {ts0}Proprietary Rights{te1}.  {legalDisplayName} retains all rights, title and interest, including all intellectual property rights, in and to {legalDisplayName}’s network controller platform and each of its components and features.  All information that you learn about {legalDisplayName} or the Services arising out of your access to or use of the Services is confidential information of {legalDisplayName}.  You agree not to use {legalDisplayName} confidential information for any reason other than for your use of the Services.  You agree not to disclose {legalDisplayName} confidential information.
termsParagraph14: 11. {ts0}Limited Warranty{te1}.  {legalDisplayName} warrants to Customer that the Services will perform substantially as described in {legalDisplayName}’s then-current, published user documentation.  {legalDisplayName}’s sole obligation under this warranty is to use commercially reasonable efforts to correct reproducible failures of the Services to perform substantially as described in {legalDisplayName}’s then-current published user documentation
termsParagraph15: 12. {ts0}Disclaimer of Warranties{te1}.  {ts2}EXCEPT FOR THE WARRANTY SET FORTH IN SECTION 11, {legalDisplayName} DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.{ts3}
termsParagraph16: 13. {ts0}Infringement{te1}.  If anyone asserts that use of the Services infringes someone’s intellectual property rights, {legalDisplayName} may (a) modify the Services to be non-infringing, (b) delete the infringing feature or features of the Services, or (c) obtain a license for your continued use of the Services.
termsParagraph17: 14. {ts0}Incidental and Consequential Damages{te1}.  {ts2}{legalDisplayName} WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, OR ANY LOSS OF PROFITS, LOSS OF REVENUE, OR LOSS OF DATA, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF {legalDisplayName} WAS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.{ts3}
termsParagraph18: 15. {ts0}Limitation of Liability{te1}.  In no event will {legalDisplayName}’s total cumulative liability to Customer and all other persons who use the Services through Customer’s account, for any and all claims, exceed 25 percent of the amount paid by Customer for the Designated Devices used in the wireless networks managed by the {legalDisplayName} Services.  {legalDisplayName} grants to you the rights set forth in Section 2 of this Agreement for no fee on the condition that you agree to the cap on {legalDisplayName}’s liability set forth in this Section.
termsParagraph19: 16. {ts0}Indemnity{te1}.  Customer will defend, indemnify, and hold {legalDisplayName}, {legalDisplayName}’s affiliates, and their respective employees, officers, directors, agents, customers, successors and assigns harmless from and against any and all liability, damages, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, legal expenses, and costs of investigation incurred or suffered by each indemnified party, arising out of, relating to or resulting from all claims, demands, suits, actions, investigations or proceedings brought by a third party to the extent based on (a) any actual or alleged negligent, reckless or intentionally wrongful act of Customer or any user of a network created or managed by use of the Services, or (b) Customer’s use of the Services in a manner not described in {legalDisplayName}’s published user documentation pertaining to the Services.
termsParagraph20: 17. {ts0}Termination{te1}.  You may stop using the Services at any time.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement or in any {legalDisplayName} website, {legalDisplayName} may terminate this Agreement and your rights to access and use the Services if you breach this Agreement.
termsParagraph21: 18. {ts0}Amendment{te1}.  {legalDisplayName} will have the right to change the terms and conditions of this Agreement at any time and from time to time by providing notice that the terms and conditions have been changed.  {legalDisplayName} may provide such notice by posting a notice on {legalDisplayName}’s website, revising the date at the top of this Agreement, sending an email, or by any other means.  Your continued use of the Services following a notice of a change in the terms and conditions will constitute your acceptance of such changes.  If you do not agree to any such change, you agree to stop using the Services.
termsParagraph22: 19. {ts0}Applicable Law and Venue{te1}.  This Agreement will be governed, interpreted, construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Oregon, U.S.A., without reference to its rules relating to choice of law to the contrary.  Customer and {legalDisplayName} hereby consent to the jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in Multnomah County, State of Oregon, U.S.A., with respect to any action or proceeding arising out of or related to this Agreement.  Neither Party will prosecute any action, suit, proceeding or claim arising under or by reason of this Agreement or the Services except in such courts.
termsParagraph23: 20. {ts0}Events Beyond Reasonable Control{te1}.  {legalDisplayName} will not be liable as a result of any cause or condition beyond its reasonable control.
termsParagraph24: 21. {ts0}Export Compliance{te1}.  You represent that you are not named on any U.S. government denied-party list.  You will not permit anyone to access or use the Services in a U.S.-embargoed country or in violation of any U.S. export law or regulation.
termsParagraph25: 22. {ts0}Entire Agreement{te1}.  This Agreement is the entire agreement between you and {legalDisplayName} regarding your use of the Services and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals or representations, written or oral, concerning its subject matter, including anything in {legalDisplayName}’s website.
termsParagraph26: 23. {ts0}Waiver{te1}.  No failure or delay by {legalDisplayName} in exercising any right under this Agreement will constitute a waiver of that right.
termsParagraph27: 24. {ts0}Severability{te1}.  If any provision of this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be contrary to law, such provision will be deemed null and void, and the remaining provisions of this Agreement will remain in effect.
termsParagraph28: 25. {ts0}Assignment{te1}.  Customer will not assign this Agreement or any of its rights under this Agreement, directly, by operation of law or otherwise, without the prior written consent of {legalDisplayName}.  Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement will be fully binding upon, inure to the benefit of and be enforceable by the parties and their respective successors and assigns.
nodeMapTransferNode: {p0} already exists in one of your networks. Would you like to transfer it to this network?
networksCreateNameValidation: Network name is limited to upper and lower-case letters (A through Z), the digits 0 through 9, and punctuation, except for + ' " \
enableAutorfOnConfirm: If you enable Auto RF, per-node channel assignments will be reset and optimized by {displayName}. Any previous channel assignments will be discarded if Auto RF is later disabled.
splashTemplateChangeConfirm: Any unsaved changes will be lost. Proceed?
voucherSettingsImageTip: Load your own image that appears on certain voucher print outs.
vouchersQuantityTip: The number of vouchers to create.
vouchersPaperSizeTip: The paper size to use if you plan to print this set of vouchers right away. Vouchers can always be reprinted from the Vouchers page.
vouchersNameTip: If you would like to use a custom code enter it here, otherwise a random code will be generated. Voucher codes are case insensitive.
vouchersCommentTip: Relevant note that will appear on the Vouchers page. Will not appear on the voucher(s) when printed out.
vouchersDurationTip: The number of hours this voucher will be valid after activation.
vouchersMaxUsersTip: The maximum number of devices that will be able to use this voucher. Can be 0-9, with 0 meaning unlimited.
vouchersDownloadLimitTip: The maximum bandwidth available to devices using this voucher when downloading.
vouchersUploadLimitTip: The maximum bandwidth available to devices using this voucher when uploading.
vouchersPurgeDaysTip: How long before unused vouchers are deleted.
vouchersSaveDefaultsTip: Check to save these settings as defaults for future voucher creation.
ssidPaypalItemIdTip: This read-only value is required as part of the process of configuring PayPal access. This field will be pasted into the PayPal Item ID field. Learn more about {ts0}configuring PayPal{te1}.
accountUpdateEmailTip: The email address associated with this master account login.
accountUpdateFirstNameTip: How we will address you in confirmation or other email.
accountUpdatePasswordCurrentTip: Confirm your changes by typing in your current password.
accountUpdatePasswordNewTip: Should be non-obvious as this is your master administrator password. It can be used to access ALL your networks. Should be different from any network password. Must be between 8 and 50 characters (maximum of 50 bytes).
vlanError: Must be a number in the range from 2 through 4094, and unique among all SSID's in this network.
nodeMapAnnotationsLinesTip: Display lines showing the signal strength between access points. Thicker lines represent stronger signals. Hovering over a repeater will display the path to its gateway, along with the RSSI values seen between them.
nodeMapAnnotationsClientsTip: Annotate each access point with the number of clients it is serving. This will be displayed only at higher zoom levels.
nodeMapAnnotationsChannelsTip: Annotate each access point with information about the channels it is using. This will be displayed only at higher zoom levels.
featureDisabledBridged: This feature is unavailable while this SSID is bridged.
transferNodeSuccess: {p0} access point(s) have been moved to network {ts1}{p2}{te3}.
networkDelete1: You are about to delete the network {p0} and all associated data.
networkDelete2: This is {ts0}NOT RECOVERABLE{te1}. The network and all related data - including the names and MAC addresses of access points - will be lost permanently.
networkDelete3: To delete your network please type "{p0}": {p1}
redactorFailure1: The HTML for your custom splash page cannot be loaded properly. Please select a template to start anew or contact support.
captivePortalTypeTip1: {displayName}: Easy to setup splash page, bandwidth and user control. Includes templates for hotels, apartments, restaurants, coffee shops and more.
captivePortalTypeTip2: Chillispot AAA: 3rd-Party Chillispot compatible AAA server.
coovaProviderTip: We recommend using the "manual" option. Specific listings will be discontinued soon. Please contact your provider for manual settings.
coovaRadiusServer1Tip: The IP of your first RADIUS server.
coovaRadiusServer2Tip: The IP of your second RADIUS server.
coovaRadiusNasIdTip: The NASID assigned to you by your RADIUS provider.
coovaUamServerUrlTip: The address of the Redirect server (web authentication portal).
coovaUamUrlTip: The locations of the login script URL on the UAM Server.
coovaUamSecretTip: The secret password for your UAM server.
coovaUamDomainUrlsTip: A list of domains separated by commas that users can access prior to authentication. Note you should NOT remove default domains from this list or your captive portal may not function. Clear this list to return to default settings.
coovaFqdnTip: The IP address or domain name of your enterprise server. Leave blank for hosted options.
ssidCpClientIdleTimeoutTip: Minutes client is idle before showing Splash Page for non-voucher access. 1 day=1440.
ssidAvailabilitySchedulingEnableTip: A WiFi schedule allows you to enable or disable each SSID for specific times of the day. The SSID will be enabled or disabled upon checkin to {displayName}, typically within five minutes of the times specified. This schedule will control the SSID only if the master Enable for the SSID is ON.
createNodeBulkMac: Bulk add access points via MAC
createNodeBulkCsv: Bulk add access points via CSV upload
nodesAddSuccess: Success! Your access point(s) have been added. It should start reporting here 5 minutes after plugging it in.
createNodeBulkCsvTip: Select a CSV file describing the access points. The field contents and ordering must match the sample file, which you may download below. All fields except the MAC address are optional and will be given default values if left empty.
createNodeBulkMacTip: Enter the MAC addresses of one or more Access Points to add, one per line.
flagBeta: This feature is being released for feedback under our public beta-test program
ssidAdvancedEnableBandSteeringTip: Band Steering attempts to connect clients to the 5Ghz band when possible in order to best utilize available bandwidth.
ssidAdvancedEnable80211rTip: 802.11r or fast BSS transition (FT) attempts to reduce handoff delay in situations where an end device is roaming from one AP to another. This is useful in applications such as VoIP calls that must maintain continuity of connection. Requires that authentication be enabled. You can enable authentication for this SSID above, on this page itself.
ssidDisabledAlert: This SSID is disabled. Enable this SSID to show and change settings.
firmwareStableModal1: You have selected stable firmware for your network, which means you will no longer receive beta updates to the existing access points, and will only receive updates to this network for firmware deemed "stable." This will not downgrade the firmware currently on your access points. To manually downgrade your access points now, you must first select "{p0}" here and then {ts1}manually flash{te2} your access points.
firmwareBetaModal1: {ts0}Enable automatic upgrades to continue.{te1} Your network will be upgraded to the stable-latest firmware version. You can upgrade now, or schedule the upgrade for later during the maintenance window. The upgrade may take up to one hour on large networks. Downgrades back to stable are not available over the air and must be done {ts2}manually{te3}.
firmwareLegacyToStableModal1: Your network will be upgraded to the stable firmware version, which includes support for four SSIDs, tracking on all SSIDs, application monitoring, Facebook WiFi and numerous other improvements. The upgrade may take up to one hour on large networks.
maintenanceWindowTip: Select the time period for {displayName} to perform maintenance such as automatic firmware upgrades and auto channel configuration. Access points may reboot during this window if changes are applied.
networksCreateLegacyTip: Selecting this option will create a legacy network to manage access points running firmware earlier than 5xx. Required for Chillispot AAA. Not recommended for most users.
advancedLocalDomainTip: Local domain to use for resources without fully qualified domain names on the LAN. Requires that an Alternate DNS server for the LAN be entered above. (In testing, not yet implemented).
migrationError1: You have one or more access points that are not upgradeable. These may include generic_ap51, OM1P, or MR500 access points. Please try again once these are removed from your network.
migrationError2: Your current captive portal is either CoovaChilli or ChilliSpot AAA, which are not available in the upgraded firmware. Please select a different captive portal configuration and try again.
migrationError3: Some access points are running an older firmware version that requires them to be online before the upgrade can start. Please bring them online or remove them from the network.
migrationError4: There are no nodes on this network to upgrade.
ssidDisabledTip: Your current firmware only tracks SSID #1. Upgrade to 5xx or later firmware in Configure > Maintenance to enable and track up to four SSIDs.
apiError12020: This SSID is currently being used to bridge wired clients and cannot be disabled. To disable it, first select a different SSID to bridge wired clients in Configure -> Advanced -> Bridge wired clients.
advancedEnablePresenceTip: Settings to configure exporting presence data about wireless clients. Commonly used for location analytics. Note that this feature will be part of a paid package of services in the future. {ts0}Learn more{te1}.
advancedPresenceSecretInvalid: Must be less than 64 characters (cannot contain | )
cloneLoading: Cloning network... May take several seconds.
networksCreateCloneTip: Cloning a network will copy all settings from that network to your new network. Access points and vouchers will not be cloned.
networksCreateType: What type of network is this?
masterSurveyQuestion0: What type of user are you?
masterSurveyQuestion1: Where do you primarily use Open Mesh products?
surveyError1: Please select where you primarily use Open Mesh products
masterSurveyIntro: Pardon the interruption! We'd like to ask you two quick questions that will help us build a better CloudTrax.
networkChangeWarning: You have switched networks in a different tab or window.
nodeStatusReboot: This access point is online but not checking in. Please {ts0}reboot{te1}.
nodeStatusBadIp: Unknown access point location. We've restricted channel use to ensure FCC compliance. {ts0}Learn More{te1}
brandingEnableTip: Allows you to create your own branded version of CloudTrax (this will be a paid service in the future).
brandingDomainEnableTip: Full domain customization (Requires you to provide an SSL certificate).
brandingDomainTip: Please create or update CNAME record for this domain to point to {p0}.
brandingCertPublicTip: This file should only include the Primary SSL Certificate given to you by your SSL certificate provider. The certificate should be PEM encoded.
brandingCertChainTip: All intermediate certificates for your SSL certificate provider combined into a single file. If you received these certificates as separate files, talk to your SSL certificate provider for help with combining them. This file should not include the Primary SSL Certificate or the Root certificate. The certificates should be PEM encoded.
brandingCertPrivateTip: The private key used to generate the Certificate Signing Request(CSR). The private key should be PEM encoded.
brandingLoginImageTip: This replaces what you see at cloudtrax.com. Include any text you want in the image itself.{lb}475x375 pixels, JPEG, PNG or GIF.
brandingNetworkLogoTip: This replaces the CloudTrax logo inside the app.{lb}170x48 pixels, JPEG, PNG or GIF.
brandingFaviconTip: This replaces the CloudTrax favicon in the browser.
brandingDisplayNameTip: This replaces any instance of the word "CloudTrax" within the app.
brandingHelpUrlTip: This replaces any references to CloudTrax Helpdesk articles. If you don't have a knowledge base link, you may provide a customer support email address.
brandingReplyToTip: Sets the reply-to header for emails.
brandingPrivacyPolicyPlaceholder: Enter text that you would like displayed when the user clicks on the 'Privacy Policy' link. Up to 15,000 characters of plain text (with Markdown support) are allowed. Leave this empty, if you do not wish to display a privacy policy link.
brandingPrivacyPolicyTip: Only plain text (with Markdown) allowed. If you leave it empty, we will not display a Privacy Policy.
brandingServiceAgreementPlaceholder: Enter text that you would like displayed when the user clicks on the 'Services Agreement' link. Up to 15,000 characters of plain text (with Markdown support) are allowed. Leave this empty, if you do not wish to display a services agreement link.
brandingServiceAgreementTip: Only plain text (with Markdown) allowed. If you leave it empty, we will not display a Services Agreement.
brandingLegalEnable: Custom Services Agreement and Privacy Policy
brandingLegalEnableTip: Adapt the existing CloudTrax services agreement and privacy policy to make them look like your own. Leaving this off will display the CloudTrax versions.
brandingLegalCompanyNameTip: This replaces any instances of the word "CloudTrax" within the privacy policy and services agreement.
brandingLegalContactInfoPlaceholder: 5 Centerpointe Drive Suite 400{lb}Lake Oswego, OR 97035{lb}United States{lb}Email: support@open-mesh.com{lb}Phone: 503-616-2764
brandingLegalContactInfoTip: This will replace the Open-Mesh contact information.
nodePaneImageTip: Upload a photo of the installed access point so you can refer to it later.
nodeImageDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this access point image? This action cannot be undone.
switchSnmpEnableTip: Enables read-only SNMP reporting on all switches in this network.
switchSnmpCommunityTip: The text here specifies the read-only community string.
userDeleteParagraph1: Are you sure you would like to delete this user?
userUpdateRolesSubtext: (pick a user role for the selected network or group)
userUpdateRoleInstruction: Pick a network or network group you would like to:
ngDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this Network Group?
ngDeleteAlert: Cannot delete a Network Group that has one or more networks in it. Either delete or move all the networks in this group to another network group before attempting to delete the selected network group.
networkCreateAdvancedDisableMatchingTip: Disabling application reporting allows APs to run at higher speeds. You can always enable application reporting from Configure > Advanced in the network. {ts0}Click here{te1} to read more.
advancedDisableMatchingTip: Disable this if you want higher Wi-Fi performance (speed). Disabling this will cause application data (pie chart and table) in the clients page to not be displayed and application data in the networks overview page to display all traffic as 'unclassified.'
switchDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this switch?{lb}{lb}This action cannot be undone and all records of this switch will be lost.
switchCreateSuccess: Success! Your switch has been added. It should start reporting here shortly after plugging it in.
ssidGeneralDisableBandsTip: Use this to limit what bands the SSID is broadcast on. Note: Selecting the 'only' options in a network with single radio devices (like the OM2P) may cause the SSID to not be broadcast at all.
transferSwitchSuccess: {p0} switch(es) have been moved to network {ts1}{p2}{te3}.
switchPaneHelp: Click here to learn more about this page
nodePaneSpareTip: Disable to turn off alerts for this specific access point (when used as a spare, client bridge, etc). Individual access point alerts can only be enabled when alerts are enabled for the entire network on the Configure > General page.
nodePaneMeshTip: The speed of this access point to the nearest gateway.
nodePaneMeshNone: This access point is in gateway mode. Mesh information is only shown for access points in repeater mode.
umMigrateP1: {ts0}Click here{te1} to learn about our new user management system. Once you have read about it, {ts2}click here{te3} to launch a wizard that will guide you through the steps to migrate your existing account to the new user management system.
umMigrateP2: This account has already been migrated to the new user management system. Please login using the account owner username ({p0}) or request a user account from that user. {ts1}Click here{te2} to learn more about the new user management system.
umMigrateP3: This account has already been migrated to the new user management system. {ts0}Click here{te1} to learn more about it.
umDisableModalP2: Please log into your account using your new user management system credentials to disable the old system.
userPasswordResetCompleteP1: Password has been set sucessfully. {ts0}Click here to login.{te1}
userVerifyComplete1: Thank you for verifying your email address. You're all set and can start using {displayName} with your new user credentials.
userVerifyComplete2: {ts0}Click here{te1} to go to the {displayName} login page.
userVerifyComplete3: {ts0}Click here{te1} to read about the various types of users supported in {displayName}.
umMigrateModalP1: This wizard will walk you through the steps to migrate to the new user management system. Please {ts0}read this{te1} help center article, if you haven't already, then click next.
umMigrateModalP4: We just sent you an email at the email address you provided for the account admin user. Once you verify that, you will be able to log into CloudTrax using your new username ({p0}) and use the features of the new user management system.
networkCreateNoAccess: You currently do not have access to any CloudTrax networks under this account. Please contact your network administrator to get access to one or more networks
switchStpEnableTip: Enables spanning tree protocol on all switches in this network. Note, root bridge information can be viewed under the "General" tab of the switch pane for a specific switch.
switchPaneStpRootBridgeTip: Information about the device elected to be the root bridge via Spanning Tree Protocol. Note that STP configuration is done in the "Switches" page of the Configure menu.
switchIgmpEnableTip: Enable IGMP snooping on this switch
switchIgmpVersionTip: Select version of IGMP protocol to use
switchIgmpVlansTip: Select VLANs that IGMP snooping should be enabled on.
switchAggregationConfirm: Are you sure you want to aggregate these ports together?
switchUnaggregationConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove port(s) {p0} from their aggregate groups? Note: one or more aggregate groups may be removed entirely after this save.
switchUnmirrorConfirm: Are you sure you want to remove port(s) {p0} from their mirroring sessions? Note: one or more mirroring sessions may be removed entirely after this save.
switchUpdatedVlans: Please check to make sure you do not remove the management VLAN (VLAN ID 1) from the PVID and Untagged VLANs columns for the uplink port.
switchMissingVlan1: Your uplink port must have the management VLAN (VLAN 1) set in both the PVID and Untagged VLANs columns. Please fix this before you can save.
portErrorRateLimit: Port Rate Limit must be between 0 and 1,000Mbps and have no more than two placeholders after the decimal.
nodePaneOverlayTip: Assign this access point to a floor plan. You can manage floor plans by clicking the settings icon in the top right corner of the map view.
userPasswordResetSendEmail: Send an email to the user so they can enter a new password.
userCreateEmailTip: Email address used to log into CloudTrax and where change notifications will be sent. Note, the user will receive instructions to set up a password, at this email address.
userCreateRoleTip: Level of privilege that this user will enjoy. Click {ts0}here{te1} to read more.
userCreateRoleDetails1: Edit account and branding; Create and edit Users, Networks, Network Groups; Edit all Network settings
userCreateRoleDetails2: Create and edit Users, Networks, Network Groups; Edit selective Network settings
ngroupsNone: You are currently not granted access any networks or network groups within this account. Please contact your Account Admin or the person that granted you access to this CloudTrax account, to be assigned one or more networks or network groups. Alternatively, you can create a new network from the Network menu on the top of this page.
networkCreateNoNgroups: Please create a Network Group first.
userCreateEmailSubject: New CloudTrax user account created ({p0}) - ACTION REQUIRED
userCreateEmailBody: You have been granted access to {p0} as a {p1} by {p2}.{lb}{lb}Please verify your account and set a password by {ts3}clicking here{te4}.{lb}{lb}Thank you,{lb}The CloudTrax team
userCreate2EmailSubject: New CloudTrax user account created - ACTION REQUIRED
userCreate2EmailBody: Please verify your account by {ts0}clicking here{te1}.{lb}{lb}Thank you,{lb}The CloudTrax team
userMigrateEmailBody: Congratulations! - your CloudTrax account has been successfully migrated to use the new user management system and {p0} has been assigned to be the Account Owner.{lb}{lb}Please verify your account by {ts1}clicking here{te2}. Once you have verified your account, you can {ts3}log in{te4} using your new credentials.{lb}{lb}Thank you,{lb}The CloudTrax team
userUpdateEmailBody: Your user information has been updated for {p0} by {p1}.{lb}{lb}Please {ts2}login{te3} to check your user privileges.{lb}{lb}Thank you,{lb}The CloudTrax team
userDeleteEmailBody: Your user account has been deleted for {p0} by {p1}.{lb}{lb}If this was not intended, please contact your CloudTrax admin.{lb}{lb}Thank you,{lb}The CloudTrax team
userPasswordResetEmailSubject: CloudTrax User password change ({p0}) - ACTION REQUIRED
userPasswordResetEmailBody: {p0} has requested that the password for your user account under {p1} be changed.{lb}{lb}Please set a new password by {ts2}clicking here{te3}.{lb}{lb}If this was not intended, please contact your CloudTrax admin.{lb}{lb}Thank you,{lb}The CloudTrax team
networksCreateNgroupTip: Select a network group that you would like this network to be a part of
promptAccountEmail: Changing the account email requires password verfication. Please enter your current password below.
enableBandSteeringConfirm: Enabling band steering will also enable this SSID on both bands. Would you still like to do this?
enableSsidPerBandConfirm: Enabling this SSID on only one band will turn band steering off. Would you still like to do this?
switchPanePortStatsNote1: Data may be between 0 and 5 minutes old.
switchPanePortStatsNote2: Counters are reset when the switch is rebooted.
switchVoiceVlanEnableTip: Enable voice VLAN on this switch
switchVoiceVlanVlanTip: Select VLAN to direct voice traffic to
switchVoiceVlanOuisTip: OUIs used to identify voice traffic. To edit this list, go to the Configure > Switches page.
switchAclShowTip: Define rules to block or allow traffic
switchQosEnableTip: Enable Quality of Service (QoS) on this switch
invalidAclName: ACL name must be between 1 and 32 characters (alphanumeric, spaces, dashes).
userSetOwnerParagraph1: This action will cause you to lose ownership rights. Note that owners cannot be deleted by any users.
invalidIcmpCode: Must be a number between 0 and 255.
invalidAclSequence: Must be a number between 1 and 256.
invalidAclPort: Must be a number or single range of numbers (e.g., 1-4096).
advancedDisableLedTip: When disabled, this turns off LED lights on your APs
switchOuiShowTip: Configure organizationally unique identifier of VoIP phone manufacturers across all switches of the network
switchQosShowTip: Configure CoS/DSCP queue mapping by assigning a switch queue to each of the possible CoS/DSCP values. 8 traffic queues are supported (1-8), with queue labeled 1 having the lowest priority and queue labeled 8 having the highest priority.
userKeyParagraph1: Manage API access for users. You may have up to 10 Key/Secret combinations per user, each of which will have all of the same permissions as the user. Note that the Keys are stored securely, so please keep track of the Key because it will not be retrievable at a later time.
userCreateApiOnlyTip: Create a user with credentials for API development only. This user will not be able to login and does not require an email address, but will otherwise have the same capabilities of a normal user.
ssidGeneralUseSsidNamePerBandTip: Specify an SSID name per band.
